base: LG.172 (6 Nov-9 Dec), Idku (9 Dec 1942-2 Feb 1943)

sources: historyofwar.org - No. 6 Squadron RAF during WW2
Imperial War Museums - RAF Operations in Middle East & North Africa 1939-1943
Key.Aero - RAF Hurricanes in Battle of El Alamein
metadata.notes: No. 6 Squadron RAF operated Hurricane Mk IID anti-tank aircraft during October-November 1942 at El Alamein, achieving its most successful day on 24 October with 16 tanks destroyed. Squadron temporarily withdrawn from anti-tank role to shipping protection duties with Hurricane Mk IIC from December 1942-February 1943. Earned nickname 'The Flying Tin Openers'. Aircraft establishment: 16 Hurricane IID (27 Oct 1942). Commander name not found in available sources. Personnel numbers not documented in tier 1/2 sources.
